name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Industry Track: Abstracts Due)
notes: Industry Track Abstracts. Follows same timeline as Research Track. For real-world systems and web innovations. Peer reviewed with rebuttal and camera-ready stages.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Industry Track: Papers Due)
notes: Industry Track Full papers. Follows same timeline as Research Track. For real-world systems and web innovations. Peer reviewed with rebuttal and camera-ready stages.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Workshops)
notes: Proposal notifications by 2025-11-17. Accepted workshop papers due 2025-12-18; notification on 2026-01-13; camera-ready by 2026-02-02.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Tutorials)
notes: Notification by 2025-12-05; materials due 2026-04-01. Covers introductory and advanced web topics.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Research Track: Abstracts Due)
notes: Full paper abstracts. Double-blind review with rebuttal (Nov 24-Dec 1); notification on 2026-01-13; camera-ready due 2026-01-25. Max 8 pages (excl. references). Limit 7 submissions per author; LLMs not allowed; anonymity required. Optional reproducibility badge. Registration required for accepted papers.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Research Track: Papers Due)
notes: Full papers. Double-blind review with rebuttal (Nov 24-Dec 1); notification on 2026-01-13; camera-ready due 2026-01-25. Max 8 pages (excl. references). Limit 7 submissions per author; LLMs not allowed; anonymity required. Optional reproducibility badge. Registration required for accepted papers.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Short Papers: Abstract Due)
notes: Short paper abstracts. Submissions should present early findings, preliminary data, or innovative ideas. Shares same notification (2026-01-13) and camera-ready (2026-01-25) timeline as full papers.

name_full: The Web Conference 2026 (Short Papers: Papers Due)
notes: Short papers. Submissions should present early findings, preliminary data, or innovative ideas. Shares same notification (2026-01-13) and camera-ready (2026-01-25) timeline as full papers.

name_full: The ACM Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Abstract/metadata deadline is mandatory; full paper submissions must be standalone. Revise & resubmit and optional video materials are included.

name_full: CHI 2026 Posters Track
notes: Up to 6 pages, ACM template, anonymous submissions; E-rights and optional video deadlines follow.

name_full: CHI 2026 Interactive Demos Track
notes: Up to 6 pages plus mandatory walkthrough video and promotional image; non-anonymous.

name_full: CHI 2026 Panels Track
notes: Panel proposals reviewed, with notification by January 15, 2026.

name_full: CHI 2026 Workshops Track
notes: Workshop proposals (up to 8 pages, ACM template), non-anonymous; juror application deadline Sept 29 2025.

name_full: CHI 2026 Meet-Ups Track
notes: Short community discussion proposals, up to 3 pages.

name_full: CHI 2026 Student Mentoring Program
notes: Student mentoring submissions; part of restructured doctoral consortium.

name_full: CHI 2026 Student Research Competition
notes: Up to 5 pages excluding references; proof of student status required.

name_full: CHI 2026 Journals Track
notes: By invitation only; for articles accepted to ToCHI/TSC or other HCI journals.

name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media 2026 - Full Papers
notes: New submissions and revise-and-resubmits (R&Rs) from January 2025 round. Double-blind review; AAAI two-column US-Letter format; 8-11 pp (up to 12 pp for camera-ready). Ethics Checklist required.

name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media 2026 - Full Papers
notes: New submissions and R&Rs from May 2025 round. Same formatting and ethics requirements as Round 1.

name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media 2026 - Full Papers
notes: New submissions and R&Rs from September 2025 round. Accepted papers will appear at ICWSM 2026.

name_display: Directions of Polarization, Social Norms & Trust in Societies 2025
name_full: Directions of Polarization, Social Norms & Trust in Societies: Perspectives from the Behavioral Sciences
notes: Two-day interdisciplinary workshop at MIT featuring faculty/postdoc speakers and graduate student posters. Abstract-only submissions acceptable; registration fee covers meals and speaker dinner.

name_full: Trust & Safety Research Conference 2025
notes: Research presentation: 12-minute presentations with discussant and Q&A. Must include original research; literature reviews are unlikely to be accepted.

name_full: Trust & Safety Research Conference 2025
notes: Lightening talks: 7-minute presentations grouped by topic. Suitable for concise, focused research overviews.

name_full: Trust & Safety Research Conference 2025
notes: Posters: displayed all day and presented during happy hour. Ideal for students. Posters will be printed by the conference.

name_full: Trust & Safety Research Conference 2025
notes: Participant-Organized Panels: 60-minute discussions with 3-4 panelists and a facilitator. Panels with cross-sector representation are favored.

name_full: Trust & Safety Research Conference 2025
notes: Workshop: 60 or 90-minute skill-based workshops. Proposals should describe the structure and learning objectives.

name_display: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
name_full: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
notes: Peer-reviewed submissions published in the September 2025 issue of the Journal of Online Trust and Safety.

name_display: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
name_full: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
notes: Commentaries: Commentaries offer brief insights or perspectives and will be published in the September 2025 journal issue.

name_full: Navigating Information Integrity in the Age of Misinformation
notes: This topical collection seeks to explore the pressing issue of misinformation and disinformation through the combined lenses of Data Science and Network Science.

name_full: ACM Transactions on Intelligent Systems and Technology Special Issue on Risks and Unintended Harms of Generative AI Systems
notes: Special issue on generative AI risks in ACM TIST. Rolling review process with final publication in early 2026.

name_full: International Conference on Computational Social Science
notes: Accepted tutorials will be held during the conference.

name_full: International Conference on Computational Social Science
notes: Accepted abstracts will be presented at the conference.

name_full: Computational Social Science Society of the Americas Conference
notes: Papers should be 3,000-5,000 words including all content. ODD documentation can be attached without word count penalty.

name_full: Computational Social Science Society of the Americas Conference
notes: Extended abstracts are 1,000-2,000 words excluding figures and tables. Not included in proceedings.

name_full: Computational Social Science Society of the Americas Conference
notes: Poster submissions require an 800-word abstract. Accepted posters must include a one-slide summary for a two-minute presentation.

name_full: Computational Social Science Society of the Americas Conference
notes: SIGs can include workshops, tutorials, or discussions. Proposals must describe event format and duration.

name_full: Cambridge Disinformation Summit
notes: 10-12 papers will be selected. Priority for newer working papers. Interdisciplinary research encouraged.

name_display: Summer School on Misinformation, Disinformation and Hate Speech 2025
name_full: Summer School on Misinformation, Disinformation and Hate Speech
notes: Hybrid format. Rolling admissions. Certificate upon completion.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - Stanford
notes: Focus on computational social science. Requires CV and research statement. Collaborative projects included.

name_full: International Workshop on Cyber Social Threats
notes: Co-located with AAAI ICWSM 2025. Accepts research, position, short, and demo papers. Double-blind review. Page limits vary by submission type. Full papers are recommended to be 8 pages long and must be less than 11 pages.

name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media
notes: First full-paper submission deadline. New submissions and revise-and-resubmit papers from Jan 2024 round.

name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media
notes: Second full-paper submission deadline. New submissions and revise-and-resubmit papers from May 2024 round.

name_full: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media
notes: Third full-paper submission deadline. New submissions and revise-and-resubmit papers from September 2024 round.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Meta data must be submitted by the 5th! Peer-reviewed archival papers. Full and short formats available.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Call for Case Studies. Practical applications of HCI research in industry or field settings.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Call for Late-Breaking Work. Up to 8 pages. Short papers presenting preliminary results.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Up to 6 pages. Hands-on demonstration of interactive systems.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Doctoral Consortium. PhD students receive guidance and feedback from senior researchers.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Student Design Competition. Students present novel design solutions to HCI challenges.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Student Game Competition. Student teams submit original game designs.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Student Research Competition. Undergraduate and graduate students present research projects.

name_full: ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
notes: Video Showcase. Creative videos demonstrating HCI concepts or projects.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - Carnegie Mellon University
notes: Designed for graduate students, postdoctoral researchers, staff, and early-career faculty. Participants are expected to fully attend and participate in the entire program. Application requires a statement of interest and CV.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - Institute for Analytical Sociology
notes: Open to Ph.D. students, postdoctoral researchers, and faculty within 7 years of their Ph.D. Lodging expenses covered; limited travel funds available. Application requires a CV and statement of interest.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - Paris
notes: Restricted to Ph.D. students, postdoctoral researchers, and early career-stage faculty from Europe and Africa. Housing provided for around 20 students during onsite days. Application requires a CV and statement of interest.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - ODISSEI
notes: Targeted at Ph.D. students, post-docs, and early career researchers, especially in sociology, psychology, economics, and political science. Participation is free; accommodation provided for those living more than 30 minutes away. Application requires a CV and short statement of motivation.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - Lingnan University
notes: Invites advanced research postgraduate students, postdoctoral researchers, and faculty within 7 years of their Ph.D. Participants expected to cover their own travel and lodging; on-campus accommodation available. Application requires a CV and statement of interest.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - National University of Singapore
notes: Designed for graduate students, postdoctoral researchers, untenured faculty within 7 years of their Ph.D., and researchers in NGOs or government agencies. Application details to be announced; check the website for updates.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - University of Pennsylvania
notes: Hosted by the University of Pennsylvania. Open to Ph.D. students, postdoctoral researchers, and junior faculty within 7 years of their Ph.D. Application requires a CV and a statement of interest.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - University of Rochester
notes: Hosted by the Goergen Institute for Data Science at the University of Rochester. Open to advanced undergraduates, Master’s students, Ph.D. students, postdoctoral researchers, and assistant professors within 7 years of their Ph.D. Application requires a CV and a statement of interest.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - University of California, Los Angeles
notes: Hosted by the UCLA Division of Social Sciences and the California Center for Population Research. Open to advanced Ph.D. students, postdoctoral researchers, and junior faculty within 7 years of their Ph.D. Application requires a CV and a statement of interest.

name_full: Summer Institute in Computational Social Science - Lake Como
notes: Hosted by the Lake Como School of Advanced Studies. Open to advanced Ph.D. students, postdoctoral researchers, and faculty within 7 years of their Ph.D. Application requires a CV and a statement of interest.

name_full: ACM Conference on Computer-Supported Cooperative Work and Social Computing 2026
notes: CSCW 2026 will be the last cycle with a single deadline. Starting in 2026, the conference will transition to rolling deadlines for submissions.

name_full: ACM Conference on Computer-Supported Cooperative Work and Social Computing 2025
notes: First submission round for new papers. Papers must adhere to the ACM PACM HCI format and be between 5,000 and 12,000 words.

name_full: ACM Conference on Computer-Supported Cooperative Work and Social Computing 2025
notes: Second and final submission round for new papers. Papers must adhere to the ACM PACM HCI format and be between 5,000 and 12,000 words.

name_full: Political Networks and Computational Social Science Conference 2025
notes: Joint conference hosted by Harvard University and Northeastern University. Accepting theoretical and empirical research papers of posters. 300 word limit.

name_full: Seventh AAAI/ACM Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Ethics, and Society
notes: Submissions may be up to 10 pages in the AAAI-2024 2-column format, with unlimited pages for references. Authors can opt for non-archival publication to accommodate subsequent journal submissions. The conference will be held at the San Jose McEnery Convention Center.

name_full: International Communication Association Conference
notes: Major conference in communication studies. Submission system opened on September 3, 2024. Acceptance notifications were sent on January 15, 2025.

name_full: International School and Conference on Network Science
notes: Poster session on June 6. Priority for authors not already presenting. One-page abstract with figure and references.

name_full: International School and Conference on Network Science
notes: Submit one-page abstract with figure and references. Presentation formats include contributed talks, lightning talks, and posters.

name_full: International Conference on the Science of Science and Innovation
notes: Submissions should be 2-page Extended abstracts in PDF format, including figures, tables, and references. Accepted presentations may be assigned as lightning talks, oral presentations, or posters. At least one author must register by April 14, 2025.

name_full: Conference on Complex Systems 2025
notes: Max 2-page PDF including abstract, one figure, and references. Presentation preference may be indicated but not guaranteed. One author must register to present.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: Archival paper track integrated with former HCOMP community. Emphasis on diverse intelligence systems including human, machine, and hybrid forms.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: Extended abstracts allow for flexible presentation formats and encourage interdisciplinary participation.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: Workshops provide in-depth engagement on emerging research areas and community building.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: Poster and demo tracks showcase work-in-progress and interactive projects. Great venue for networking and early-stage feedback.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: Poster and demo tracks showcase work-in-progress and interactive projects. Great venue for networking and early-stage feedback.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: CrowdCamp: a hands-on collaborative workshop for developing new tools and approaches in human computation and crowdsourcing.

name_full: ACM Collective Intelligence 2025
notes: Doctoral Colloquium. Mentorship opportunity for PhD students to present their research and receive feedback from senior scholars.

name_full: International Conference on Computational Social Science
notes: Tutorial day is July 28. Acceptance notifications by February 16, 2026. Tutorials aimed at early-career scholars.

name_full: International Conference on Computational Social Science
notes: Max 2-page extended abstract (PDF), anonymized for double-blind review. Figures/tables do not count toward page limit. Accepted work assigned to lightning talks (~6 min), oral presentations (~15 min), or poster sessions. Acceptance notifications by April 14, 2026. At least one author must register by early-bird deadline (May 8, 2026).

name_full: International Communication Association Conference
notes: Theme: 'Communication and Inequalities in Context'. Full papers up to 8,000 words or extended abstracts 1,000-2,500 words. Limit 3 individual submissions. Deadline was 12:00 Noon ET.

name_full: Ninth AAAI/ACM Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Ethics, and Society (Abstracts Due)
notes: Abstract registration deadline. Double-anonymized review. Up to 10 pages in AAAI-2026 format. Authors choose archival or non-archival publication. At least one author must attend in person.

name_full: Ninth AAAI/ACM Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Ethics, and Society (Papers Due)
notes: Full paper deadline. Up to 10 pages in AAAI-2026 format, unlimited references. Optional ethics/positionality/adverse impact statement (1 extra page). Notification July 16, 2026.

name_full: Conference on Complex Systems 2026
notes: 1-page extended abstract with one mandatory figure. Hybrid format (in-person + Zoom). Notification June 1, 2026. Warm-up Oct 9-10, main conference Oct 12-16.

name_full: International School and Conference on Network Science
notes: 20th anniversary. One-page abstract with figure using official LaTeX template. Formats: contributed talks (12 min), lightning talks (3 min), or posters. Must present in person. Hosted by Northeastern University.

name_full: International Workshop on Cyber Social Threats
notes: Co-located with ICWSM 2026. Theme: 'Human-AI Relationships: Risks, Rewards, and Responsibilities'. Accepts research (8-11 pp), position (5 pp), short (5 pp), and demo (4 pp) papers. Double-blind, AAAI format. Ethics checklist required.

name_full: Trust & Safety Research Conference 2026
notes: 5th annual conference at Frances C. Arrillaga Alumni Center. Accepts research presentations, lightning talks, poster presentations, and workshop proposals. Presentation application deadline may differ from JOTS deadline.

name_display: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
name_full: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
notes: Peer-reviewed submissions published in the October 2026 issue of the Journal of Online Trust and Safety, timed with the Trust & Safety Research Conference.

name_display: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
name_full: Journal of Online Trust and Safety
notes: Commentaries offer brief insights or perspectives and will be published in the October 2026 issue of the Journal of Online Trust and Safety, timed with the Trust & Safety Research Conference.

name_full: Cambridge Disinformation Summit
notes: At King's College, Cambridge. 10-12 papers selected. Priority for newer working papers. Interdisciplinary research encouraged. Paper submission fee required. Original deadline was November 15, 2025 at 23:59 BST.

name_full: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ARR Submission)
notes: ARR paper submission deadline. Long papers: 8 pages, short papers: 4 pages. Double-blind via OpenReview. Theme: 'Explainability of NLP Models'. Mandatory peer reviewing for all authors.

name_full: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (ARR Submission)
notes: ARR paper submission deadline. Long papers: 8 pages, short papers: 4 pages. Double-blind via OpenReview. Theme: 'Interdisciplinary Recontextualization of NLP'. Mandatory peer reviewing.

name_full: Conference on Language Modeling (Abstracts Due)
notes: Abstract submission deadline. Max 9 pages main text. Rebuttal May 22-June 8. Notification July 8. Max 25 submissions per person. Double-blind via OpenReview.

name_full: Conference on Language Modeling (Papers Due)
notes: Full paper deadline. At Hilton Union Square. LLM usage disclosure required. Per-submission reciprocal reviewing. Dual submission with other archival venues prohibited during review.
